description: Dashboard for monitoring Project Calico's per-host agent, Felix.  Project Calico provides CNI networking and security for Kubernetes.  Felix is responsible for calculating and applying the per-node dataplane state.  It also collects flow logs and other metrics.

panels.description: Total number of Node resources that Felix "sees" in the datamodel.
panels.title: Nodes in datamodel

panels.description: Total number of network Policies and Profiles (an internal policy-like resource used to represent namespaces/service accounts).
panels.title: Number of policies/profiles/tiers

panels.description: Total number of Endpoints (Pods/VMs/host endpoints) in the datamodel as seen by Felix.
panels.title: Endpoints in datamodel

panels.description: Number of times the Felix process restarted in 1 hour moving window.  Note that Felix restarts (within the calico-node pod) when its configuration is changed so some restarts are expected when adjusting the FelixConfiguration resource.  In addition, Felix is restarted when the pod is restarted or upgraded.
panels.title: Felix restarts/hr (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of times Felix resynced with the datastore (for example reconnecting with Typha).  Resyncs are normal if Typha is rebalancing load or restarting during upgrade etc.
panels.title: Felix datastore resyncs/hr (top $top_n)

panels.description: CPU usage of the Felix process only; does not include sub-processes such as iptables.
panels.title: CPU Usage (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of open file descriptors.  If this trends upwards over time, indicates a leak.
panels.title: Open file descriptors(top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of garbage collections performed over time.
panels.title: Runtime GC rate/min (top $top_n)

panels.description: The Go runtime's current target heap size.
panels.title: Runtime GC target heap size (top $top_n)

panels.description: The Go runtime's current target heap size.
panels.title: Runtime GC target heap size (average)

panels.description: Felix process memory usage (resident set size).  does not include sub-processes/other components of calico-node.
panels.title: Process memory (RSS) (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of workload and host endpoints on each node.
panels.title: Active local endpoints (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of policies that are active on each node.  Policies are active when they apply to a local endpoint.  Only active policies consume dataplane resources.
panels.title: Active local policies (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of label selectors that are active on each node.  Label selectors become active when used in a rule of an active policy.  Each label selector has an ongoing CPU cost proportional to the churn rate of endpoints.
panels.title: Active local selectors (top $top_n)

panels.description:
Percentage of the time that the calculation graph thread is actively updating the desired state of the local node.  Approaching 100% indicates that the calculation graph is overloaded.

Overload can be caused by lack of a CPU reservation on the calico-node pod, or by a too-small CPU reservation, or by very high datastore churn rate.
panels.title: Calculation graph load (top $top_n)

panels.description: Rate of calculation graph updates
panels.title: Calculation graph updates/s (top $top_n)

panels.description: The 99%ile time to update the calculated desired state of the dataplane
panels.title: 99%ile calculation update time (top $top_n)

panels.description:
Fraction of time that the dataplane thread is actively updating the dataplane.  Approaching 100% indicates the dataplane is overloaded.  Updates will be delayed and batched resulting in increased update latency.

Overload can be caused by high churn; very large rule sets; lack of a CPU reservation on the calico-node pod, or by a too-small CPU reservation on calico-node.
panels.title: Dataplane update load (top $top_n)

panels.description: Rate of dataplane operations, including updates to the dataplane and periodic resyncs.
panels.title: Dataplane operations/min (top $top_n)

panels.description: The 99%ile tiem to update the dataplane in felix's main dataplane update loop.  Longer times indicate increasing latency to update the dataplane with new updates from the datastore.
panels.title: 99%ile dataplane update time (top $top_n)

panels.description: Rate of errors returned from subprocesses such as iptables/ipset/etc.  Some background errors are expected due to resource contention in the kernel but high error rates should be investigated.
panels.title: Dataplane subprocess errors (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of Calico-owned iptables rules
panels.title: Iptables rules (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of Calico-owned IP sets
panels.title: IP sets (top $top_n)

panels.description: Rate of events sent from BPF programs to Felix.  Events are used to tell Felix about new flows.
panels.title: Events/s (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of kernel-to-Felix events lost due to buffer overruns (Felix not keeping up with the event stream).
panels.title: Lost events (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of conntrack table entries seen at the last conntrack table garbage collection.
panels.title: Conntrack table entries (top $top_n)

panels.description: Time taken to scan the eBPF conntrack table
panels.title: Conntrack sweep duration (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of times the kernel-to-Felix buffer overran resulting in lost events (and hence missing flow log information)
panels.title: NFLOG buffer overruns (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of buffered connection information objects waiting to be sent from the NFLOG reader to the log collector.
panels.title: NFLOG backlog size (top $top_n)

panels.description: Fraction of the time that the NFLOG reader thread spends waiting to send logs downstream.  Time spent waiting cannot be spent reading logs.
panels.title: NFLOG flush wait time (top $top_n)

panels.description: Number of pre-aggregation flows that the collector is tracking information about.
panels.title: Cached flows (top $top_n)

list.description: The label to apply to each instance of a metric.  For example, if your prometheurs metrics are labeled with pod name as a "pod", label, set this to {{pod}}
list.label: Instance label
list.name: instance_label

title: Calico: Felix
